Description: The host of the Gravitino server.
The port on which the Gravitino server listens for incoming connections.
The minimum number of threads in the thread pool used by the Jetty webserver. minThreads is 8 if the value is less than 8.
The maximum number of threads in the thread pool used by the Jetty webserver. maxThreads is 8 if the value is less than 8, and maxThreads must be great or equal to minThreads.
The size of the queue in the thread pool used by the Jetty webserver.
Time in milliseconds to gracefully shut down the Jetty webserver, for more, please see org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server#setStopTimeout.
The timeout in milliseconds of idle connections.
Maximum size of HTTP requests.
Maximum size of HTTP responses.
Time in milliseconds to gracefully shut down of the Gravitino webserver.
Comma-separated list of filter class names to apply to the API.
Comma-separated list of REST API packages to expand
List of configs that are visible in the config servlet
Which entity storage implementation to use. Onlyrelational storage is currently supported.
The maximum skew time of transactions in milliseconds.
The maximum time in milliseconds that deleted and old-version data is kept. Set to at least 10 minutes and no longer than 30 days.
The Count of versions allowed to be retained, including the current version, used to delete old versions data. Set to at least 1 and no greater than 10.
Detailed implementation of Relational storage. H2, MySQL and PostgreSQL is currently supported, and the implementation is JDBCBackend.

The database url that the JDBCBackend needs to connect to. If you use MySQL or PostgreSQL, you should firstly initialize the database tables yourself by executing the ddl scripts in the ${GRAVITINO_HOME}/scripts/{DATABASE_TYPE}/ directory.
The jdbc driver name that the JDBCBackend needs to use. You should place the driver Jar package in the ${GRAVITINO_HOME}/libs/ directory.
Required: Yes if the jdbc connection url is not jdbc:h2

Description: The username that the JDBCBackend needs to use when connecting the database. It is required for MySQL.
Required: Yes if the jdbc connection url is not jdbc:h2

Description: The password that the JDBCBackend needs to use when connecting the database. It is required for MySQL.
Required: Yes if the jdbc connection url is not jdbc:h2

Description: The storage path for embedded JDBC storage implementation. It supports both absolute and relative path, if the value is a relative path, the final path is ${GRAVITINO_HOME}/${PATH_YOU_HAVA_SET}, default value is ${GRAVITINO_HOME}/data/jdbc
The maximum number of connections for the JDBC Backend connection pool
The maximum wait time in milliseconds for a connection from the JDBC Backend connection pool
The maximum number of tree lock nodes to keep in memory
The minimum number of tree lock nodes to keep in memory
The interval in seconds to clean up the stale tree lock nodes
The interval in milliseconds to evict the catalog cache; default 3600000ms(1h).
Whether to use an isolated classloader for catalog. If true, an isolated classloader loads all catalog-related libraries and configurations, not the AppClassLoader. The default value is true.
The auxiliary service name of the Gravitino Iceberg REST server. Use iceberg-rest for the Gravitino Iceberg REST server.
It is deprecated since Gravitino 0.6.0. Please use gravitino.authenticators instead.

The authenticators which Gravitino uses, setting as simple,oauth or kerberos. Multiple authenticators are separated by commas. If a request is supported by multiple authenticators simultaneously, the first authenticator will be used by default.
The audience name when Gravitino uses OAuth as the authenticator.
The JWT allows skew seconds when Gravitino uses OAuth as the authenticator.
The signing key of JWT when Gravitino uses OAuth as the authenticator.
Required: Yes if use oauth as the authenticator

Description: The signature algorithm when Gravitino uses OAuth as the authenticator.
The URI of the default OAuth server.
Required: Yes if use oauth as the authenticator

Description: The path for token of the default OAuth server.
Required: Yes if use oauth as the authenticator

Description: OAuth provider type (default, oidc). Determines the Web UI authentication flow. Use 'oidc' for Web UI OIDC login, 'default' for legacy login or API-only authentication.
OAuth client ID for Web UI authentication.
OAuth authority/issuer URL for OIDC providers for web UI authentication. (e.g., Azure AD tenant URL).
OAuth scopes for Web UI authentication (space-separated).
JWKS URI for server-side OAuth token validation. Required when using JWKS-based validation.
JWT claim field(s) to use as principal identity. Comma-separated list for fallback in order (e.g., 'preferred_username,email,sub').

Fully qualified class name of the OAuth token validator implementation. Use org.apache.gravitino.server.authentication.JwksTokenValidator for JWKS-based validation or org.apache.gravitino.server.authentication.StaticSignKeyValidator for static key validation.
Indicates the Kerberos principal to be used for HTTP endpoint. Principal should start with HTTP/.
Required: Yes if use kerberos as the authenticator

Description: Location of the keytab file with the credentials for the principal.
Required: Yes if use kerberos as the authenticator

Description: Enable cross-origin resource share filter.
A comma separated list of allowed origins to access the resources. The default value is *, which means all origins.
A comma separated list of allowed origins to time the resource. The default value is the empty string, which means no origins.
A comma separated list of allowed HTTP methods used when accessing the resources. The default values are GET, POST, HEAD, and DELETE.

A comma separated list of allowed HTTP headers specified when accessing the resources. The default value is X-Requested-With,Content-Type,Accept,Origin. If the value is a single *, it accepts all headers.
The number of seconds to cache preflight requests by the client. The default value is 1800 seconds or 30 minutes.
A boolean indicating if the resource allows requests with credentials. The default value is true.
A comma separated list of allowed HTTP headers exposed on the client. The default value is the empty list.
If true chained preflight requests for normal handling (as an OPTION request). Otherwise, the filter responds to the preflight. The default is true.
Enables HTTPS.
The HTTPS port number of the Jetty web server.
Path to the key store file.
Password to the key store.
The type to the key store.
Manager password to the key store.
TLS protocol to use. The JVM must support the TLS protocol to use.
The collection of enabled cipher algorithms.
Enables the authentication of the client.
Path to the trust store file.
Required: Yes if use HTTPS and the authentication of client

Description: Password to the trust store.
Required: Yes if use HTTPS and the authentication of client

Description: The type to the trust store.
The auxiliary service name of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service. Use iceberg-rest.

The classpath of the Gravitino Iceberg REST catalog service; includes the directory containing jars and configuration. It supports both absolute and relative paths, for example, iceberg-rest-server/libs, iceberg-rest-server/conf
